meanings.sent1: The candy was claggy and got stuck to my fingers.
meanings.sent2: Her hands felt claggy after playing with the glue.
meanings.sent3: The claggy tape refused to let go of the paper.
meanings.sent4: The claggy mud held onto our shoes like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The claggy dough was challenging to work with in the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: The claggy table was difficult to clean after the spilled syrup.
meanings.sent2: The tree branches were claggy with sap after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The claggy cat walked across the floor leaving sticky paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The claggy spider web glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The claggy candy wrapper clung to the sidewalk.

meanings.sent1: The dough began to claggy as she added more flour.
meanings.sent2: The tape will claggy if left in the heat for too long.
meanings.sent3: The glue seemed to claggy faster than usual in the warm room.
meanings.sent4: The syrup started to claggy as it cooled down.
meanings.sent5: The mud clagged onto the boots making them heavy to walk in.
